text: Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale.

On this episode of Laura in the Kitchen, I
want to share with you an updated out of this

world delicious, blueberry muffin recipe that
is going to be your go-to.

It is really easy, but I'm telling that once
you make these, you will never make another

kind of blueberry muffin again, and since
blueberries are just at their peak right now,

especially - I feel really lucky because we
live in an area where they've got blueberries
growing abundantly and they are absolute perfection.

Let me run you through the list of ingredients
because it's really short and sweet but they're
all the right ones.

You'll need all purpose flour, salt, baking
powder, baking soda, lots of fresh blueberries,

you need some buttermilk, I'll talk about
this in just a minute, couple of eggs, and

in here, I've got some cold unsalted butter,
a little bit of flour, a little bit of sugar,
a little bit of cinnamon.

Vegetable oil, granulated sugar, and you'll
need vanilla extract.
And that is it.

I've got my oven preheated to 400F, a muffin
pan ready and lined, so if you follow me on

Instagram, you would have seen me and Mia,
my daughter, make these a lot lately because

we just love them, the whole family does,
and they are just wonderful, especially for
a weekend treat.

For he buttermilk, you can go out and buy
regular buttermilk, I don't tend to really
do that anymore because it just goes to waste.

So I just take whole milk, ad about a teaspoon
or so of either vinegar or lemon juice, and

let that sit for a while, and it starts to
curdle for a bit and it is perfect.

This recipe is the easiest thing in the entire
world.

Actually going to start here just because

I'm just mixing together my dry ingredients
really quickly.

And then I'm going to take some of these dry
ingredients and I'm going to toss my blueberries

in them because what happens is this makes
sure that the blueberries are coated with

the flour and they don't sink to the bottom
of the batter.

Add the dry ingredients.

And then what I do is I kind of just, I mix

not need it all, typically you use about three

on the batter, you don't want it too thick,
you don't want it too loose, you want it just
right.

Now we just add the blueberries with all of
the flour.
